column4: I'm about to set up Ubuntu 10.04 on my laptop that currently has Fedora 12 on it, and would like some help setting up GRUB...
I'd like to have Ubuntu's GRUB as the default, as pointed to by the MBR, but handing control off to Fedora's GRUB for booting Fedora, so that Fedora can update its GRUB with a new kernel when needed.
You want to chain load grub.  Google for that.  I have set it up before, but only once.
